name: Mitigation Playbook for PowerShell Malicious Script Incident
description: This playbook addresses an incident where a PowerShell script was used by a threat actor to execute malicious commands and create unauthorized user accounts.

action--05eec3a4-3210-4b9f-a8fb-97b149b5.name: Terminate malicious PowerShell processes
action--05eec3a4-3210-4b9f-a8fb-97b149b5.description: Terminate any running PowerShell processes that are executing malicious commands.

action--2a1b281e-8b77-44a8-b72e-d8a72b0a.name: Remove unauthorized user accounts
action--2a1b281e-8b77-44a8-b72e-d8a72b0a.description: Remove any unauthorized user accounts that have been created as a result of the attack.

if-condition--e07c1b2c-d467-4d5d-9d69-fd.name: Check if outbound IP is blocked

action--e07c1b2c-d467-4d5d-9d69-fd452d44.name: Block outbound connections to suspicious IP
action--e07c1b2c-d467-4d5d-9d69-fd452d44.description: Create a firewall rule to block outbound connections to the malicious IP address.

action--f1c1121f-9a25-43ce-a7b7-0999697a.name: Scan affected systems for residual malware
action--f1c1121f-9a25-43ce-a7b7-0999697a.description: Perform a full system scan to identify any residual malware left by the attack.

while-condition--436f2dab-43b9-438c-bc63.name: Check for malware scan result
while-condition--436f2dab-43b9-438c-bc63.description: Check the results of the malware scan, repeat until the system is clean.
